intro: Angylocalyx schumannianus var. vermeulenii, commonly known as the Schumann's angylocalyx, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native region.
